title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**What Makes Us a Great Place To Work**
 We are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world’s best places to work. We are currently the \\#1 ranked consulting firm on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work list and have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor’s list since its founding in 2009\\. Extraordinary teams are at the heart of our business strategy, but these don’t happen by chance. They require intentional focus on bringing together a broad set of backgrounds, cultures, experiences, perspectives, and skills in a supportive and inclusive work environment. We hire people with exceptional talent and create an environment in which every individual can thrive professionally and personally.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll join our Machine Learning and Data Science experts within within the AI, Insights \\& Solutions team. This team is part of Bain’s digital capabilities practice, which includes experts in analytics, engineering, product management, and design. In this multidisciplinary environment, you'll leverage deep technical expertise with business acumen to help clients tackle their most transformative challenges. You’ll work on integrated teams alongside our general consultants and clients to develop data\\-driven strategies and innovative solutions. Together, we create human\\-centric solutions that harness the power of data and artificial intelligence to drive competitive advantage for our clients. Our collaborative and supportive work environment fosters creativity and continuous learning, enabling us to consistently deliver exceptional results.
   

  

**WHERE YOU’LL FIT WITHIN THE TEAM**
 As a Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll help drive innovation by integrating AI and data\\-driven solutions into strategy and execution. Whether launching new ventures, reimagining user experiences, or building tech\\-enabled products, you’ll work at the intersection of analytics and impact—turning bold strategies into breakthrough results.
 **We** 
**are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team and encourage candidates of all backgrounds to** 
**apply.** 
 Bain offers comprehensive benefits and flexible policies that are designed to support you, so you can thrive personally and professionally.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design, build, and deliver statistical/ML models and agentic AI/LLM solutions to solve high\\-impact client problems.
* Architect and implement production\\-grade ML systems by building enterprise\\-grade services, applying MLOps and CI/CD for reliable deployment and monitoring, and ensuring high standards in engineering quality and documentation.
* Partner with general consulting teams and client stakeholders to translate business problems into ML solutions, prioritize work, and enable enterprise‑scale AI transformation.
* Continuously research emerging frameworks and state‑of‑the‑art AI (e.g., LLMs, agents, retrieval, post\\-training, etc.) and convert learnings into reusable frameworks, components, and accelerators used across industries and functions.
* Share knowledge and mentor others on best practices tools, and approaches in applied machine learning and AI engineering.
* Contribute to internal R\\&D and learning initiatives to advance Bain’s AI capabilities and foster continuous innovation between projects.


**About You**
**Must Have:**
* 3\\+ years of relevant experience or an advanced degree
* Strong theoretical and practical experience in machine learning
* Proficiency in Python, with solid software engineering foundations — including clean code practices, testing, version control, and CI/CD workflows.
* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and deploying ML/AI applications.
* Comprehensive understanding of the ML lifecycle, from experimentation and model development to deployment.
* Experience productionizing and exposing ML models (e.g., using FastAPI, Flask, or similar frameworks) for seamless integration into applications and platforms.
* Excellent communicator and collaborator, able to align with technical and business stakeholders in a fast\\-paced, cross\\-functional environment.
* Curious and growth\\-oriented, passionate about exploring new tools, mentoring peers, and sharing best practices.
* Adaptable and self\\-driven, comfortable operating with autonomy, embracing feedback, and learning new skills to deliver client impact.
* Willingness to travel internationally (up to 30%) as required by project needs.
* Location: New Delhi, Bengaluru, Mumbai (Hybrid)


**Nice To Have**
 Experience with R\\&D or academic research
   

  

 Interest in publishing technical content and mentoring others

title: Sr. Salesforce Specialist
description:
**About Vistaprint Corporate Solutions**
 Vistaprint is the ecommerce industry leader in personalized physical and digital products, with over 23 years of legacy. We empower over 20 million global customers to make an impression – and we’re fuelled by forward\\-thinking and innovative technology. Vistaprint Corporate Solutions (VCS) is a line of business under Vistaprint serving the commercial mid\\-market (corporate) segment and the small reseller segment, with a suite of solutions including ProShop and ProAdvantage:
   

  

 Proshop helps companies overcome the logistical challenges of creating and ordering custom print and promotional items across several teams while ensuring brand consistency. Our long\\-term aspiration is to help larger businesses portray and grow a consistent brand image via design and brand\\-management capabilities, on print and digital mediums.
   

  

 ProAdvantage allows small resellers to focus on what they love most: creating, and what matters the most to them: their business, while we take care of order fulfillment for them.
   

  

**About The Team**
 At VCS, we’re redefining how businesses deliver consistent branding with cutting\\-edge solutions that simplify the distribution of custom merchandising and marketing materials. As part of our fast\\-paced, entrepreneurial environment, the Business Intelligence \\& Integration team plays a pivotal role in enabling data\\-driven decisions, optimizing workflows, and building innovative systems to empower our global sales and support teams.
   

  

 With a start\\-up mindset, our team thrives on collaboration, experimentation, and a relentless pursuit of excellence. Together, we are revolutionizing the custom print and digital marketing solutions space for mid\\-market businesses. Join us and make your mark at the intersection of technology, strategy, and customer impact. Learn more at .
   

  

**About The Job**
 At Vistaprint Corporate Solutions (VCS), we empower mid\\-market businesses with tailored marketing solutions and innovative technologies. As part of our growing Business Intelligence \\& Integration team, we are looking for a Senior Salesforce Specialist to enhance our CRM capabilities and ensure smooth, efficient operations across our global sales ecosystem.
   

  

 This role is pivotal in maintaining and optimizing Salesforce functionalities, enabling seamless processes, and improving data accessibility to drive decision\\-making. Working closely with the Salesforce Architect, Salesforce Admins and Analysts, you’ll ensure that Salesforce remains a reliable backbone for our customer\\-facing teams, contributing to VCS’s mission of delivering exceptional solutions to our clients.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

* Own Salesforce Development \\& Platform Health Be the technical owner of our Salesforce org from a development standpoint. Manage user onboarding/offboarding, IAM, roles, profiles, and configurations while also monitoring system performance, code scalability, and platform stability to ensure a secure, reliable, and high\\-performing environment.
* Design \\& Build Custom Solutions Develop scalable customizations using Apex (Triggers, Classes, Batch, Queueable), Lightning Web Components (LWC), and Visualforce where necessary. Translate complex business requirements into secure, maintainable, and reusable technical solutions aligned with Salesforce best practices
* Support Releases, Testing, and Deployment Contribute to the development lifecycle: analysis, design, build, test, deploy, and maintain. Participate in code reviews, create test classes to ensure 75%\\+ code coverage, and manage deployments across sandbox environments using Change Sets or SFDX\\-based CI/CD tools.
* Automate and Optimize Business Processes Leverage both declarative and programmatic tools to streamline business operations. Build and refine automations using Flows, Validation Rules, and Apex logic to eliminate manual work, minimize errors, and improve team efficiency across Sales, Service, and Operations. Test and document changes so automations stay stable as the business scales.
* Deliver actionable reporting \\& dashboards Create intuitive reports and dashboards that give Sales, Marketing, Customer Service and Leadership the insights they need to act upon like pipeline health, quota progress, funnel conversion, and other KPIs. Translate data into clear, consumable visuals and scheduled reports.
* Protect and improve data quality Run regular data audits, manage bulk imports/exports, clean duplicates, and enforce data governance so Salesforce remains the single source of truth. Proactively identify bad data patterns and fix them at the root. Communicate any anti\\-patterns or non\\-compliance proactively.
* Support integrations \\& light development Develop, maintain, and optimize integrations between Salesforce and external systems (e.g., Marketing, Finance, BI tools) using REST and SOAP APIs, Connected Apps, and middleware solutions. Ensure data synchronization, transaction integrity, and robust error handling. Manage third\\-party integrations (e.g., DocuSign, sales engagement tools, marketing platforms). Evaluate and implement Salesforce AppExchange solutions to enhance functionality.
* Support and enable users Partner with business stakeholders to understand challenges and provide quick technical resolutions. Deliver timely support, training, and documentation. Maintain documentation, process guides, knowledge articles, and support resources to improve adoption and user confidence in collaboration with our training teams
* Collaborate on roadmap \\& strategy Work closely with the Salesforce Architect, Admins, and Business teams to design scalable solutions and enhance platform capabilities. Participate in backlog grooming, technical design discussions, and provide input on architectural decisions and integration strategies.


 What makes you a Great Candidate
   

  

* 3\\+ years of hands\\-on Salesforce development experience in Apex, LWC, and declarative tools (with strong Salesforce administration knowledge)
* Salesforce certifications such as:
+ Platform Developer I (required)
+ Platform Developer II, Administrator, or App Builder (preferred)

* Strong understanding of Salesforce architecture, data models, and security frameworks (Profiles, Roles, Permission Sets, Sharing Rules)
* Strong understanding of Salesforce Sales Cloud, Service Cloud (incl. Amazon Connect), and Lightning Platform
* Proficiency with Apex (Classes, Triggers, Batch, Queueable, Schedulable), Lightning Web Components (LWC), and SOQL/SOSL
* Solid experience with Flows, Validation Rules, Custom Objects, and Record Types
* Experience integrating Salesforce with external systems using REST/SOAP APIs, Platform Events, and Connected Apps.
* Experience using data management tools (Data Loader, Import Wizard, Workbench)
* Experience with Change Set deployments or SFDX\\-based CI/CD tools (Gearset/Copado/Jenkins)
* Ability to translate business requirements into scalable, efficient, and maintainable solutions
* Experience building reports and dashboards for actionable business insights
* Strong collaboration and communication skills to work with cross\\-functional teams and business stakeholders
* Knowledge of Salesforce best practices for governance, adoption, and scalability
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field
* Exposure to Einstein Analytics or Experience Cloud or any other Einstein offerings is a plus.


 Why you’ll Love working Here
   

  

 Being at Vista means that you don’t see work as just a building, a desk, or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey – and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what’s next, we’re always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we’re capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work.
   

  

 What’s in it for You (Besides the best\\-in\\-class Rewards)
   

  

* An OPPORTUNITY to be a part of the e\\-commerce market leader in the mass customization upload, design, and print industry.
* A chance to GROW professionally building technology solutions for a largely unorganized market.
* A system that EMPOWERS each member with a high degree of trust, freedom, and autonomy.
* A GLOBAL team that has some of the best minds in sales, marketing, product, user experience, data, and engineering.
* A REMOTE\\-FIRST operating model and impeccable work culture.


 Equal Opportunity Employer
   

  

 Vistaprint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

title: SAP VC QA & Modeler
description:
Scope of Role
   

  

 Regal Rexnord’s IT team is seeking a skilled
 **SAP Variant Configuration (VC) QA \\& Modeler** 
 to join our enterprise applications team. This role is ideal for a seasoned configuration expert with a strong grasp of ERP VC logic, testing practices, and cross\\-functional collaboration.
   

  

 You will play a key role in shaping the accuracy, scalability, and maintainability of configurable product models within our global SAP and Salesforce environments. This includes working hands\\-on with model logic, leading quality assurance efforts, and partnering with teams across Digital Solutions, engineering, IT, and product management to align solutions with business needs.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Designing and maintaining SAP VC Models across various business units in Europe and North America. Should have hands\\-on experience in the creation/modification/maintenance of following VC objects.
* Characteristics
* Class 300/200/201
* Variant Tables
* Object dependencies (Preconditions, Selection Conditions, Procedures)
* Dependency Nets
* Configuration Profiles with Interface design
* Material Master
* Super Bills of material
* Super Routings
* Variant Conditions for Pricing within the SAP system for the sale and production of products.
* Perform functional and integration testing of VC with other SAP models.
* Should be able to debug issues appearing in day\\-to\\-day VC functioning.
* Lead QA efforts, including test strategy development, execution, and issue resolution
* Support On\\-shore and Off\\-shore VC modelers in debugging issues, UAT and Smoke testing.
* Ensure models and blueprints comply with VC best practices, performance expectations, and business rules
* Conduct model reviews and provide feedback to ensure logic consistency and technical integrity
* Create and maintain documentation for configuration logic, testing frameworks, and modeling standards
* Analyze integration platforms (such as Mulesoft) input and output to debug issues
* Stay current with the latest testing trends in ERP’s and Salesforce
* Test SAP VC integration with SD, MM, PP, and other relevant SAP modules for order fulfillment
* Mentor junior modelers and QA analysts, and support knowledge\\-sharing across the team


**Qualifications**
 Technical Skills Required:
   

  

* 5–7 years of SAP QA experience, 2\\-3 years of VC experience. Expertise in SAP VC: object dependencies (procedures, constraints, preconditions, selection conditions), classes, characteristics
* Solid understanding of SAP S/4HANA or ECC environments
* Hands\\-on experience with testing strategies and validation for SAP VC
* Interest in Learning Logik.ai
* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field (or equivalent experience)


 Preferred (Not Required):
   

  

* Experience with SAP IPC or AVC
* Experience with Logik.ai and Salesforce CPQ tools and QA best practices
* Knowledge of SAP Product Configuration Lifecycle Management (PCLM)
* Exposure to DevOps tools or Agile project methodologies
* SAP certification in Variant Configuration or related modules


**About Regal Rexnord**
 Regal Rexnord is a publicly held global industrial manufacturer with 30,000 associates around the world who help create a better tomorrow by providing sustainable solutions that power, transmit and control motion. The Company’s electric motors and air moving subsystems provide the power to create motion. A portfolio of highly engineered power transmission components and subsystems efficiently transmits motion to power industrial applications. The Company’s automation offering, comprised of controls, actuators, drives, and precision motors, controls motion in applications ranging from factory automation to precision control in surgical tools.
   

  

 The Company’s end markets benefit from meaningful secular demand tailwinds, and include factory automation, food \\& beverage, aerospace, medical, data center, warehouse, alternative energy, residential and commercial buildings, general industrial, construction, metals and mining, and agriculture.
   

  

 Regal Rexnord is comprised of three operating segments: Industrial Powertrain Solutions, Power Efficiency Solutions, and Automation \\& Motion Control. Regal Rexnord has offices and manufacturing, sales and service facilities worldwide. For more information, including a copy of our Sustainability Report, visit RegalRexnord.com.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
At Advisor360°, we build technology that transforms how wealth management firms operate, scale, and serve their clients. As a leading SaaS platform in the fintech space, we’re trusted by some of the largest independent broker\\-dealers and RIAs to power the full advisor and client experience—from portfolio construction and reporting to compliance and client engagement.
   

  

 What sets us apart? It's not just the tech (though it's best\\-in\\-class). It's the people, the purpose, and the passion behind everything we do.
   

  

 We’re a team of builders, thinkers, and doers who believe that great companies are defined by the stories they tell and the experiences they create—internally and externally. We bring deep industry expertise, a collaborative spirit, and a commitment to innovation as we reshape what’s possible in wealth management.
   

  

 As we grow, we’re looking for teammates who are ready to roll up their sleeves, think big, and help elevate our brand in a way that reflects the bold ambitions we have for our company and the clients we serve.
   

  

 Join us, and be part of a company that's not only moving fast—but making it count.
   

  

 As a Data Engineer – Data Platform at Advisor360°, you will design, build, and scale the data pipelines and platforms that power our SaaS solutions. Your work will ensure that data is fast, reliable, and secure, enabling us to deliver better reporting, insights, and experiences to clients — and helping Advisor360° move faster in the market.
   

  

 This is a hands\\-on role with opportunities to shape architecture, leverage modern tools, and mentor peers.
   

  

****This is a hybrid role, with an on\\-site presence required at our Bengaluru office on Monday \\& Wednesday.****
**Here’s What You’ll Do**
* Architect and implement scalable cloud\\-based data solutions using Azure, Databricks, PySpark, and Snowflake.
* Build and optimize data pipelines for performance, reliability, and cost efficiency.
* Leverage GenAI tools to accelerate coding, testing, and automation.
* Develop and maintain data documentation, coding standards, and best practices.
* Design event\\-driven and streaming solutions using Kafka or similar tools.
* Automate infrastructure with Terraform, Bicep, or ARM templates.
* Ensure compliance, security, and quality across all data systems.
* Collaborate with product and engineering teams to align data solutions with GTM priorities.
* Mentor teammates and champion modern data engineering practices.


**What You Bring To The Table**
* 8\\+ years of experience in data engineering or software engineering.
* Strong skills in SQL, PySpark, and Databricks.
* Hands\\-on experience with Azure cloud services (Data Factory, Functions, Databricks).
* Knowledge of event\\-driven architecture (Kafka, Streams).
* Familiarity with CI/CD, Git, and agile development.
* Experience with IaC tools (Terraform, Bicep, ARM templates).
* Exposure to GenAI\\-powered development is a plus.
* Mindset: Ownership, problem\\-solver, fast learner, thrives in fintech GTM environment.


****Why You’ll Love Working Here****
**About**
 It’s not just about work—it’s about building a career and enjoying the ride! Here’s what you can expect:
   

  

* Comprehensive health benefits, including medical, life, disability, and OPD coverage for you and your family.
* Annual health checkups and wellness programs to support preventive care.
* Unlimited paid time off to help you recharge and thrive.
* Hybrid work model with in\\-office collaboration twice a week.
* Access to certifications, online courses, workshops, and tuition reimbursement.
* Be part of a fintech that combines startup agility with enterprise stability.
* Direct impact on how Advisor360° delivers data\\-driven solutions faster to clients and the market.


 Join us on this journey. Advisor360° is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. We believe diversity drives innovation and are therefore building a company where people of all backgrounds are truly welcome and included. Everyone is encouraged to bring their unique, authentic selves to work each and every day. The way we see it, we are here to learn from each other

title: Lead Accessibility Engineer
description:
**Description**
 The Product Accessibility team seeks an energetic, motivated and resourceful individual to join our growing team.
   

  

 As a digital accessibility engineer, you collaborate with the Product Accessibility leadership to accelerate the development of accessible products and services across the enterprise. You are passionate about accessibility and are excited about the opportunity to transform the way Salesforce products are built. You solve problems, gravitate towards collaboration, and strive for quality.
   

  

 As an accessibility subject matter expert, you are looked to as an expert, mentor, and evangelist for creating accessible and inclusive products. You educate and train product teams on specific accessibility requirements and the use of tools that teams can use to incorporate accessibility early in the software development lifecycle. You work closely with designers, developers and product management to enhance existing accessibility features and help create new ways to make products more accessible and usable by people with disabilities.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Partner with product management, designers, developers and inclusive design to deliver accessible products and features by providing expertise and establishing best practices throughout the software development lifecycle.
   

  

 Function as a subject matter expert on accessibility, staying ahead of trends in disability advocacy, universal and inclusive design, and web standards.
   

  

 Participate on large\\-scale projects or initiatives researching, documenting, prototyping and promoting best practices for usability and accessibility.
   

  

 Collaborate with designers to review designs ensuring that accessibility is baked into the product before development starts
   

  

 Assist developers in addressing accessibility challenges by delivering specifications and providing functional prototypes of solutions so they can meet web accessibility standards in their deliverables.
   

  

 Work with product teams to provide manual and automated reviews, diagnose issues and recommend solutions.
   

  

 Educate teams to leverage automated testing, interpret test failures, identify false positives and provide support for recommended fixes.
   

  

 Partner with the accessibility automation engineering team to increase validation rulesets, pilot and evaluate new testing frameworks and conduct training as needed.
   

  

 Partner with the Product Accessibility Enablement team to propose, create and deliver content for building accessible and inclusive products.
   

  

 Work with product teams to ensure products are regularly audited and results are resolved, including reviewing audit findings, helping to prioritize fixes and identifying enablement gaps.
   

  

 Facilitate and encourage collaboration and transparency across disciplines, geographies, and company departments.
   

  

 Provide ad hoc accessibility support and guidance to designers and engineers.
   

  

**Minimum Requirements**
**Lead Digital Accessibility Engineer \\- 9\\+ years experience.
   

  

 Senior Digital Accessbility Engineer \\- 7 \\+ Years experience**
**Qualifications**
 Commensurate level of knowledge and experience with the following:
   

  

 3\\+ years working as a digital accessibility engineer.
   

  

 Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI) guidelines and specifications.
   

  

 Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)
   

  

 HTML, CSS, JavaScript and ARIA
   

  

 Design pattern and component libraries
   

  

 Assistive technology and accessibility\\-related software, including JAWS, NVDA, VoiceOver, and ZoomText
   

  

 Automated accessibility tools (e.g. Axe) and experience interpreting results, drafting test rules, piloting new test automation frameworks, recommending fixes and training teams to use automation tools.
   

  

 Advanced soft skills and mastery of working with teams who may not have any understanding of inclusive design or accessibility.
   

  

 Ability to collaborate productively both independently and with diverse global teams.
   

  

 Proven organizational and multitasking skills.
